CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 17, 1951, pg. 10, reads: "MISS LOIS WEAVER...Variety Show Dancer." Article begins: "A gala assemblage of talent has been signed on the dotted line for the April 6 variety show, "Stars on Parade," presented by a group of Holy Cross Episcopal Church members, headed by Mrs. Marion Holmes.  All real stars, either in song, dance or amusing skits, the show has begun to sound like a Broadway offering deluxe.  Lois Weaver, the talented dancing teacher now on the staff at the Marie Carter Hays School, herself a student of classical modern dancing, will give an an Afro-Haitian ritual number, accompanied on drums by Martha Billups Hunt of the YWCA staff..."
TitMainTitle: Full length portrait of Lois Weaver Watson, wearing dark leotard with light colored belt and ballet shoes, standing on toes, in Harris Studio
